page.title: 03Gretton House made safe
page.content: A battle by Gretton villagers for action to be taken over a burned-out house has finally come to an end. The house,in Corby Road, owned by the British Steel Corporation, was burned down two years ago and the Parish Council declared it to be an eyesore, completely spoiling the entrance to the village. However, work on the house has now been started and a British Steel spokesman has said that the building would be partly demolished and made safe. He could not reveal when the work would be finished or how much it would cost. At the time of writing this page work was nearly completed but no plans for rebuilding have as yet been published.
